Program Name: Bachelor of Early Childhood Education – Honours
Code: C305
Credential: Honours Bachelor's Degree
Duration: 2 years (4 semesters)
Starting Months: September
Domestic Tuition: $8,346.00* † ‡ ^
International Tuition: $19,900.00* † ‡ ^
Location: George Brown College at Toronto Metropolitan University Campus
Method of Study: Full-time
Program Description: This program is designed for those with an Early Childhood Education diploma wishing to pursue a degree in early childhood leadership. It will prepare students to become a progressive leader in this complex field.
Entrance Scholarships: Students are eligible for two separate entrance scholarships — a $1000 entrance scholarship and a second $1200 entrance scholarship.
Additional Funding: Students starting this program in September 2023 will receive an additional $2,000 in each of Semesters 5, 6, 7, and 8.*
*Funded in partnership with the City of Toronto, The Region of Durham, The Region of Peel, the Province of Ontario, and the Government of Canada under the new Canada-Ontario Early Childhood Workforce Agreement.

Context:
The George Brown College offers a Bachelor of Early Childhood Education – Honours degree program for those with an Early Childhood Education diploma, intended to prepare students for progressive leadership roles in the complex and evolving early childhood sector. The part-time study option is available. Students enrolled in this two-year program will examine pedagogy and policy related to the Early Childhood sector, as well as delve into leadership studies. In the spring/summer semester following the third year, students will participate in a 10-week unpaid internship and have the opportunity to focus on an area of research, policy or practice. The program is eligible for two entrance scholarships worth $1000 and $1200 respectively, and students starting in September 2023 will receive an additional $2,000 in each of Semesters 5, 6, 7 and 8.

Key Information:
- Program: Bachelor of Early Childhood Education – Honours
- Duration: Two years
- Entrance Scholarships: $1000 and $1200
- Additional Funding (September 2023 intake): $2,000 per semester for four semesters
- Part-time study option available.

Context:
The George Brown College Honours Bachelor of Early Childhood Leadership program offers students an opportunity to conduct research in their chosen area before completing a research project for their thesis. The program includes field education options with placements offered every year, the longest being a 14-week full-time internship between semesters 6 and 7. This unpaid internship may be local, within Canada or international. Students are expected to demonstrate leadership skills during placement.

Graduates of this program will have the knowledge and practice base to influence pedagogy and curriculum in various early childhood settings such as child care centres, family drop-in programs, early intervention services, and family support programs. They will be prepared for positions as Registered Early Childhood Educators in Ontario's Full-Day Early Learning programs or guide and lead curriculum and pedagogy in other early childhood settings.

The college owns and operates over 1,100 children each year through its largest network of school-owned and operated child care centres located across the Greater Toronto Area (GTA). Some clinical or work placement partners may require students to show proof of full vaccination against COVID-19. For the latest updates on COVID-19, please visit their page.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Bachelor of Early Childhood Education – Honours Program (Degree Completion) C305 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The Honours Bachelor of Early Childhood Leadership degree program at Best Start Child and Family Centres integrates graduates into existing early childhood programs for leadership positions. Graduates have gained admission to master's degree programs and the faculty of education at Toronto Metropolitan University for further studies.

Toronto Metropolitan University offers the following postgraduate study opportunities for graduates:
- Master of Arts in Early Childhood Studies

The required courses for the program include:
- Semester 5: ECL 3101 (Quality Assurance for Early Childhood Programs), ECL 3102 (Leadership in Learning Organizations), ECL 3103 (Leadership in a Technological World), and ECL 2102 (Applied Research Methods). Select two Liberal Studies electives.
- Semester 6: ECL 3201 (Human Development: Current Topics), ECL 3202 (Building Healthy Communities: Advocacy and Leadership), ECL 3205 (Internship Seminar). ECL 4102 (Curriculum Leadership in Early Learning and Care) and ECL 4103 (Managing Projects as an Early Childhood Leader). Select one Liberal Studies elective.
- Semester 7: ECL 3203 (Early Childhood Program and System Delivery), ECL 4111 (Research in Early Childhood Studies), ECL 4105 (Field Seminar 3), and ECL 4106 (Field Practicum 3). Select two Liberal Studies electives.
- Semester 8: ECL 4211 (Current Issues – Leadership for Quality) or independent studies, LHUM 1215 (Social Policy in Canada), and select one Liberal Studies elective.

The program learning outcomes include the ability to analyze interacting social and biological forces that shape early brain development and set the stage for lifelong learning, behavior, and health, and respect families' central role in child development.

Course revisions may be taking place, and course offerings may change without notice.

Context: The text describes various responsibilities and duties of individuals involved in early childhood education at the college. Context:
Financial Assistance: This program is approved for OSAP funding for applicants who meet OSAP eligibility criteria. (Note: Information is subject to change.)

Admission Requirements:
1. Early Childhood Education (ECE) diploma with a minimum program GPA of 2.5.
2. Early Childhood Education (ECE) diploma with a minimum three years related work experience in ECE, along with resumé and reference letters.
3. Completion of three George Brown College Continuing Education bridge courses by mid-August with a minimum grade of B-.
4. A Liberal Studies course must be completed prior to completing Year 3 of the program.
5. Online information session attendance (other arrangements will be made for applicants unable to attend).

English Language Proficiency: George Brown College ESL Level 9, TOEFL 84 overall and 21 in each skill band, IELTS 6.5 overall and 6.0 in each skill band, MELAB 85, CAEL overall 70 (writing 60).

Course Exemptions: College or university credits may qualify for course exemptions; visit the Transfer Guide for more information.

International Students: Visit the International Admissions page for country-specific admission requirements.

Special Requirements:
1. Field placement is mandatory and complex component of the program, accommodation issues will be addressed with an Accessible Learning Consultant if needed.
2. Students must have completed the following prior to beginning field placement: Standard First Aid with CPR level C course, Police Vulnerable Sector Check, medical clearance.
3. For more information on ECE Field Placement requirements email ece@georgebrown.ca.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Bachelor of Early Childhood Education – Honours Program (Degree Completion) C305 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
* The ECE Field Placement requirements can be obtained by emailing ece@georgebrown.ca.
* Clinical placement partners may require students to show proof of vaccination.
* Third-year entry to the Early Childhood Leadership (ECL) program is available for working professionals with an ECE diploma.
* This program starts in September and requires completion of three Continuing Education "Bridge" courses: ECE 2058, Competent Learner; ECL 1002, Introduction to Early Childhood Leadership; ECL 1308, Human Development; and ECL 1205, Composition & Rhetoric.
* The minimum grade point average required for bridge courses is 2.5. For the Early Childhood Leadership (Fast-Track) program, applicants must complete three bridge courses by mid-August.
* Applicants accepted into the program will be assigned a faculty advisor and a faculty supervisor for independent study in Year 4.
* The consent for offering the applied degree was granted in August 2017 and is valid for a seven-year term. George Brown will apply for renewal 12 months before expiration.
* Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges, while international students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System.
* Contact information: School of Early Childhood, Phone: 416-415-5000, ext. 2310; Email: ece@georgebrown.ca.
